name: Sequence ID
description: The SI data type is used for sequence identifiers or counter values within HL7 messages. It provides a simple numeric sequence for identifying order, position, or count in a series. Commonly used for segment repetition counters, item numbering, and maintaining order in repeating fields or segments.

constraints.increment: Usually increments by 1 for each occurrence
constraints.uniqueness: Must be unique within the context of use
constraints.startValue: Typically starts at 1 for first occurrence

usage: OBX.1 - Set ID for Observation segment repetitions
NTE.1 - Set ID for Notes and Comments segment repetitions
AL1.1 - Set ID for Patient Allergy Information repetitions
DG1.1 - Set ID for Diagnosis segment repetitions
Sequence counters in repeating segments and fields

generationHints.patterns: Increment by 1 for each repetition in the same message
generationHints.context: Reset to 1 for each new patient or encounter
generationHints.validation: Ensure no gaps or duplicates within the same context

sequenceRules.uniqueness: No duplicate sequence IDs within the same segment type for a single entity
sequenceRules.continuity: Should not have gaps unless segments are conditionally omitted
sequenceRules.reset: Sequence typically resets for each new patient or message group

validationRules.sequentialCheck: Should follow logical sequence within message context
validationRules.rangeValidation: Should be within reasonable bounds for message size

implementationNotes.purpose: Maintains order and identification in repeating structures
implementationNotes.processing: Used by receiving systems to maintain proper sequence
implementationNotes.debugging: Critical for troubleshooting message parsing and segment ordering
implementationNotes.standards: Essential for HL7 message structure integrity
